poem:
**A Century of Focus**

In the quiet click of shutters past,  
suffragettes lace their boots with light.  
The Blitz holds its breath, smoke stilled—  
protests spool, a silver thread unrolled,  
captured and hanging.  
  
Margate reads the negatives,  
each frame a whisper gathered,  
as cameras remember  
what seemed so easily forgotten.

Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
